p:
Finally, the three climate-change scenarios (no change, low, and high) were combined with the two sets of socioeconomic scenarios to give six sets of climate-socioeconomic scenarios under which the poverty model was run. The data outputs from the poverty model used to drive the stunting model were national-level average GDPpc of the lowest 20% of the population (
GDPpc
20
ij
) and average incomes in rural and urban areas (
income
ij
R
and
income
ij
U
, respectively), as well as population (split into agricultural and nonagricultural for all ages and children
< 15
). (See the original paper for a full description of the poverty model ( Hallegatte and Rozenberg 2017)).
